title: Saururaceae
text: Saururaceae is a plant family comprising four genera and seven species of <a href="herbaceous">herbaceous</a> <a href="flowering%20plant">flowering plant</a>s native to eastern and southern <a href="Asia">Asia</a> and <a href="North%20America">North America</a>. The family has been recognised by most taxonomists, and is sometimes known as the "lizard's-tail family". The <a href="APG%20IV%20system">APG IV system</a> (2016; unchanged from the 2009 <a href="APG%20III%20system">APG III system</a>, the 2003 <a href="APG%20II%20system">APG II system</a> and the 1998 <a href="APG%20system">APG system</a>) assigned it to the order <a href="Piperales">Piperales</a> in the clade <a href="magnoliids">magnoliids</a>.
